\section*{Exercises for 5.11-5.12}

\begin{enumerate}


 \item Add missing items (Hint: lines 6 and 11  are one of the more useful 
  theorems of sentential logic):


\begin{argumentN}[1]
%generated by gentzen

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lforall x \lnot Fx}{\mc{\lnot }\lforall x \lnot Fx}{A}

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lthereis x Fx}{\mc{\lnot }\lthereis x Fx}{A}

\ai[0.15]{Fa}{Fa}{A}

\ai[0.15]{Fa}{\mc{\lthereis x }Fx}{\mask{3,\exI}}

\ai[0.15]{}{\mask{Fa\mc{\limplies }\lthereis x Fx}}{4,\condI}

\ai[0.15]{}{\mask{(Fa\limplies \lthereis x Fx)\mc{\limplies }(\lnot \lthereis x 
Fx\limplies \lnot Fa)}}{\mask{CP}}

\ai[0.15]{}{\lnot \lthereis x Fx\mc{\limplies }\lnot Fa}{5,6,\condE}

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lthereis x Fx}{\mc{\lnot }Fa}{\mask{2,7,\condE}}

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lthereis x Fx}{\mask{\mc{\lforall x }\lnot Fx}}{8,\uniI}

\ai[0.15]{}{\lnot \lthereis x Fx\mc{\limplies }\lforall x \lnot Fx}{\mask{9,\condI}}

\ai[0.15]{}{\mask{(\lnot \lthereis x Fx\limplies \lforall x \lnot Fx)
  \mc{\limplies }
(\lnot \lforall x \lnot Fx\limplies \lnot \lnot \lthereis x Fx)}}{\mask{CP}}

\ai[0.15]{}{\lnot \lforall x \lnot Fx\mc{\limplies }\lnot \lnot \lthereis x Fx}{10,11,
\condE}

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lforall x \lnot Fx}{\mc{\lnot }\lnot \lthereis x Fx}{\mask{1,
  12,
\condE}}

\ai[0.15]{\mc{\lnot }\lforall x \lnot Fx}{\mc{\lthereis x }Fx}{13,\negE}

\end{argumentN}



 \item Suppose it is true that \lbh{-p -f UxCAFxGxHx}, and suppose that 
  \p{Fa}, where \p{a} is a constant. It follows that \p{Ha}. Turn this into a 
  derivation. Here are the first two lines:
  
  \begin{argument*}
   \ai{\Gamma}{\lforall x [(Fx\lor Gx)\limplies Hx]}{premise}
   \ai{\Delta}{Fa}{premise}
  \end{argument*}
  \opts{

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline
}
{\vskip 1.5em
 \begin{argumentN}[3]
	\ai{\Delta}{Fa\lor Ga}{2,\disjI}
	\ai{\Gamma}{(Fa\lor Ga) \limplies Ha}{1,\uniE}
	\ai{\Gamma,\Delta}{Ha}{3,4,\condE}

  \end{argumentN}

 }

 \newpage
\item Suppose everyone gets grumpy when hungry. So if everyone is hungry, 
 everyone is grumpy. Turn this into a derivation. Here are the first two lines 
 (\p{Hx} means x is hungry, \p{Gx} means x is grumpy; the conclusion you want to 
 reach is \p{\seq{\Gamma}
  {\lforall x Hx \limplies \lforall x Gx}}):


\begin{argumentN}[1]
%generated by gentzen

\ai{Γ}{\mc{\lforall x }(Hx\limplies Gx)}{premise}

\ai{\mc{\lforall x }Hx}{\mc{\lforall x }Hx}{A}

\end{argumentN}
\opts{

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline
}
{
 \vskip 1.5em
 \begin{argumentN}[3]
\ai{\mc{\lforall x }Hx}{Ha}{2,\uniE}

\ai{Γ}{Ha\mc{\limplies }Ga}{1,\uniE}

\ai{Γ, \mc{\lforall x }Hx}{Ga}{3,4,\condE}

\ai{Γ, \mc{\lforall x }Hx}{\mc{\lforall x }Gx}{5,\uniI}

\ai{Γ}{\lforall x Hx\mc{\limplies }\lforall x Gx}{6,\condI}
\end{argumentN}
}




 \item Consider: No one is flawless; so everyone has flaws. Let's turn this into 
  a derivation. Let \p{Fx} mean `x has flaws' and let \p{k} be a constant. Hint:  
  assume that \p{k} is not \p{F}.  

  \opts{
\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline
}
{

   \begin{argument*}
	\ai{\Gamma}{\lnot\lthereis x\lnot Fx}{premise}
	\ai{\lnot Fk}{\lnot Fk}{A}
	\ai{\lnot Fk}{\lthereis x \lnot Fx}{2,\exI}
	\ai{\Gamma,\lnot Fk}{\lnot\lthereis\lnot Fx}{1}
	\ai{\Gamma}{\lnot\lnot Fk}{3,4,\negI}
	\ai{\Gamma}{Fk}{5,\negE}
	\ai{\Gamma}{\lforall xFx}{6,\uniI}
   \end{argument*}

	
 }
\newpage


  \item Consider: dragons are mythical creatures; but there are no mythical 
   creatures; thus, there are no dragons. Formalize this. Let \p{Dx} mean that 
   \p{x} is a dragon, \p{Mx} mean that \p{x} is a mythical creature. Hint: 
   derive something that enables you to use \negI{}.

   \begin{argument*}
	\ai{\Gamma}{\forall x (Dx \limplies Mx)}{premise}
	\ai{\Delta}{\lnot\lthereis x Mx}{premise}
	\ai{\lthereis x Dx}{\lthereis x Dx}{A}
	\ai{Da}{Da}{A}
	\ai{\Gamma}{Da\limplies Ma}{1,\uniE}
\end{argument*}
\opts{ 

 \dotline
 \dotline
 \dotline
 \dotline
 \dotline
 \dotline
 \dotline

}
{
\vskip 1.5em
\begin{argumentN}[6]
	\ai{\Gamma,Da}{Ma}{4,5,\condE}
	\ai{\Gamma,Da}{\lthereis xMx}{6,\exI}
	\ai{\Gamma,\lthereis xDx}{\lthereis xMx}{3,7,\exE}
	\ai{\Delta,\lthereis xDx}{\lnot\lthereis xMx}{2}
	\ai{\Gamma,\Delta}{\lnot\lthereis x Dx}{8,9,\negI}
   \end{argumentN}
  }

\item Prove \p{\seq{}{\lforall x(Fx\limplies \lforall yGy) \limplies \lforall 
 x\lforall y(Fx \limplies Gy)}}.

 (Hint: use \uniE{} to get rid of the quantifiers, and then put them back on 
 using \uniI.) \opts{

  \dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline

\dotline
}
{

  \p{a} and \p{b} are constants not appearing in \p{\Gamma}.

\begin{argumentN}[1]
%generated by gentzen

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{\mc{\lforall x }
(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{A}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{Fa\mc{\limplies }\lforall y Gy}{1,\uniE}

\ai[0.25]{Fa}{Fa}{A}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy), Fa}{\mc{\lforall y }Gy}{2,3,\condE}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy), Fa}{Gb}{4,\uniE}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{Fa\mc{\limplies }Gb}{5,\condI}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{\mc{\lforall y }(Fa\limplies Gy)}{6,\uniI}

\ai[0.25]{\mc{\lforall x }(Fx\limplies \lforall y Gy)}{\mc{\lforall x }\lforall y (Fx\limplies Gy)}{7,\uniI}

\end{argumentN}

 }
\end{enumerate}
